prop.name: unitCode
prop.desc: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

prop.name: minValue
prop.desc: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

prop.name: value
prop.desc:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

  • For QuantitativeValue and MonetaryAmount, the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
  • For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.

prop.name: additionalProperty
prop.desc:
A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.

Note: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

prop.name: valueReference
prop.desc: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

prop.name: maxValue
prop.desc: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

prop.name: unitText
prop.desc: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.
